“There is not enough time to do all the nothing we want to do.”
“Man is so made that he can only find relaxation from one kind of labor by taking up another.”
“If you cant define it or act upon it, forget it.”
“The benefits of becoming fluent in a foreign tongue are as underestimated as the difficulty is overestimated.”
“If you dont make mistakes, youre not working on hard enough problems. And thats a big mistake.”

“Surround yourself with smiling, positive people who have absolutely nothing to do with work. Create your muses alone if you must, but do not live your life alone. Happiness shared in the form of friendships and love is happiness multiplied.”
“There is nothing the busy man is less busied with than living; there is nothing harder to learn.”

“SLOW DANCE Have you ever watched kids On a merry-go-round? Or listened to the rain Slapping on the ground? Ever followed a butterflys erratic flight? Or gazed at the sun into the fading night? You better slow down. Dont dance so fast. Time is short. The music wont last. Do you run through each day On the fly? When you ask: How are you? Do you hear the reply? When the day is done, do you lie in your bed With the next hundred chores Running through your head? Youd better slow down. Dont dance so fast. Time is short. The music wont last. Ever told your child, Well do it tomorrow? And in your haste, Not see his sorrow? Ever lost touch, Let a good friendship die Cause you never had time To call and say, Hi? Youd better slow down. Dont dance so fast. Time is short. The music wont last. When you run so fast to get somewhere You miss half the fun of getting there. When you worry and hurry through your day, It is like an unopened gift thrown away. Life is not a race. Do take it slower. Hear the music Before the song is over.”
“Oftentimes, in order to do the big things, you have to let the small bad things happen.”
“Once you realize that you can turn off the noise without the world ending, youre liberated in a way that few people ever know.”
“Time without attention is worthless, so value attention over time.”
“What is the one goal, if completed, that could change everything?”
“Let the small bad things happen and make the big good things happen.    —OCTOBER 25, 2007”
“Dont accept large or costly favors from strangers.”
“You dont have to recoup losses the same way you lose them.”
“One of the most universal causes of self-doubt and depression: trying to impress people you dont like.”
“Adversity doesnt build character; it reveals it.”
“Money doesnt change you; it reveals who you are when you no longer have to be nice.”
“Youre never as bad as they say you are.”
“Are you having a breakdown or a breakthrough?”
“A mindset of scarcity (which breeds jealousy and unethical behavior) is due to a disdain for those things easily obtained”
“Opportunities abound in bad times as well as good times.”
“Trip enjoyment is inversely proportionate to the amount of crap (read: distractions) you bring with you.”
“The more options you consider, the more buyers regret youll have.”
“The more options you encounter, the less fulfilling your ultimate outcome will be.”
“You had time but you didnt have attention, so the time had no practical value.”
“Considering options costs attention that then cant be spent on action or present-state awareness.”
“Attention is necessary for not only productivity but appreciation.”
“1. Set rules for yourself so you can automate as much decision making as possible”
“Dont provoke deliberation before you can take action.”
“Dont postpone decisions just to avoid uncomfortable conversations.”
“Learn to make nonfatal or reversible decisions as quickly as possible.”
“Fast decisions preserve usable attention for what matters.”
“1. Do not answer calls from unrecognized phone numbers. Feel free to surprise others, but dont be surprised. It just results in unwanted interruption or poor negotiating positions.”
“Do not agree to meetings or calls with no clear agenda or end time.”
“Do not work more to fix overwhelmingness—prioritize.”
“Financial goal of a start-up should be simple: profit in the least time with the least effort.”
“Profitability often requires better rules and speed, not more time.”

“Who you portray in your marketing isnt necessarily the only demographic who buys your product—its often the demographic that most people want to identify with or belong to. The target isnt the market. No one aspires to be the bland average, so dont water down messaging to appeal to everyone—it will end up appealing to no one.”
“Being busy is not the same as being productive.”
“The 80/20 principle, also known as Paretos Law, dictates that 80% of your desired outcomes are the result of 20% of your activities or inputs.”
“Perfect products delivered past deadline kill companies faster than decent products delivered on time.”
“Self-improvement and success often occur together. But that doesnt necessarily mean theyre the same thing.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Ironically, this fixation on the positive—on whats better, whats superior—only serves to remind us over and over again of what we are not, of what we lack, of what we should have been but failed to be.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “A confident man doesnt feel a need to prove that hes confident.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Giving too many fucks is bad for your mental health.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The key to a good life is not giving a fuck about more; its giving a fuck about less, giving a fuck about only what is true and immediate and important.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “I feel like shit, but who gives a fuck?”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Our crisis is no longer material; its existential, its spiritual.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Because theres an infinite amount of things we can now see or know, there are also an infinite number of ways we can discover that we dont measure up, that were not good enough, that things arent as great as they could be.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The desire for more positive experience is itself a negative experience. And, paradoxically, the acceptance of ones negative experience is itself a positive experience.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The more you pursue feeling better all the time, the less satisfied you become, as pursuing something only reinforces the fact that you lack it in the first place.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The avoidance of suffering is a form of suffering. The avoidance of struggle is a struggle. The denial of failure is a failure.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Everything worthwhile in life is won through surmounting the associated negative experience.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Hiding what is shameful is itself a form of shame.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “When you give too many fucks—when you give a fuck about everyone and everything—you will feel that youre perpetually entitled to be comfortable and happy at all times, that everything is supposed to be just exactly the fucking way you want it to be. This is a sickness. And it will eat you alive. You will see every adversity as an injustice, every challenge as a failure, every inconvenience as a personal slight, every disagreement as a betrayal.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “They reserve their fucks for what truly matters. Friends. Family. Purpose. Burritos. And an occasional lawsuit or two.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “No matter where you go, there you are.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Not giving a fuck does not mean being indifferent; it means being comfortable with being different.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “To not give a fuck about adversity, you must first give a fuck about something more important than adversity.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “When a person has no problems, the mind automatically finds a way to invent some.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “This book will help you think a little bit more clearly about what youre choosing to find important in life and what youre choosing to find unimportant.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Life itself is a form of suffering. The rich suffer because of their riches. The poor suffer because of their poverty. People without a family suffer because they have no family. People with a family suffer because of their family. People who pursue worldly pleasures suffer because of their worldly pleasures. People who abstain from worldly pleasures suffer because of their abstention. This isnt to say that all suffering is equal. Some suffering is certainly more painful than other suffering. But we all must suffer nonetheless.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Pain and loss are inevitable and we should let go of trying to resist them.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Happiness is not a solvable equation. Dissatisfaction and unease are inherent parts of human nature and, as well see, necessary components to creating consistent happiness.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Problems dont end.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Problems never fucking go away, he said—they just improve.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The solution to one problem is merely the creation of the next one.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Happiness is a constant work-in-progress, because solving problems is a constant work-in-progress—the solutions to todays problems will lay the foundation for tomorrows problems, and so on.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Solve problems; be happy.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Forms of blame and denial give us a quick high. They are a way to temporarily escape our problems, and that escape can provide us a quick rush that makes us feel better.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “If you feel crappy its because your brain is telling you that theres a problem thats unaddressed or unresolved.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “To deny ones negative emotions is to deny many of the feedback mechanisms that help a person solve problems. As a result, many of these repressed individuals struggle to deal with problems throughout their lives.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Hedonic treadmill: the idea that were always working hard to change our life situation, but we actually never feel very different.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “What we gain is also what we lose.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “What pain do you want in your life? What are you willing to struggle for?”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Happiness requires struggle. It grows from problems.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People want a partner, a spouse. But you dont end up attracting someone amazing without appreciating the emotional turbulence that comes with weathering rejections, building the sexual tension that never gets released, and staring blankly at a phone that never rings. Its part of the game of love. You cant win if you dont play.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “What determines your success isnt, What do you want to enjoy? The relevant question is, What pain do you want to sustain?”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “I didnt even try hard enough to fail at it.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Who you are is defined by what youre willing to struggle for.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People who enjoy the stresses and uncertainties of the starving artist lifestyle are ultimately the ones who live it and make it.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Our struggles determine our successes.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Our problems birth our happiness, along with slightly better, slightly upgraded problems.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “A true and accurate measurement of ones self-worth is how people feel about the negative aspects of themselves.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People who are entitled delude themselves into whatever feeds their sense of superiority. They keep their mental facade standing at all costs, even if it sometimes requires being physically or emotionally abusive to those around them.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The true measurement of self-worth is not how a person feels about her positive experiences, but rather how she feels about her negative experiences. A person like Jimmy hides from his problems by making up imagined successes for himself at every turn. And because he cant face his problems, no matter how good he feels about himself, he is weak.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “A person who actually has a high self-worth is able to look at the negative parts of his character frankly—Yes, sometimes Im irresponsible with money, Yes, sometimes I exaggerate my own successes, Yes, I rely too much on others to support me and should be more self-reliant—and then acts to improve upon them.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Like all parents, my parents, with the best of intentions, imparted some of their problems to me, as I probably will to my kids.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “It wasnt so much the sex I craved, although the sex was fun. It was the validation. I was wanted; I was loved; for the first time since I could remember, I was worthy. My craving for validation quickly fed into a mental habit of self-aggrandizing and overindulgence.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “What most people dont correctly identify as entitlement are those people who perpetually feel as though theyre inferior and unworthy of the world.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “It takes just as much energy and delusional self-aggrandizement to maintain the belief that one has insurmountable problems as that one has no problems at all.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The truth is that theres no such thing as a personal problem. If youve got a problem, chances are millions of other people have had it in the past, have it now, and are going to have it in the future.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Often, its this realization—that you and your problems are actually not privileged in their severity or pain—that is the first and most important step toward solving them.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Its strange that in an age when we are more connected than ever, entitlement seems to be at an all-time high.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The more exposed we are to opposing viewpoints, the more we seem to get upset that those other viewpoints exist.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The easier and more problem-free our lives become, the more we seem to feel entitled for them to get even better.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Perhaps these same technologies that have liberated and educated so many are simultaneously enabling peoples sense of entitlement more than ever before.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Our lives today are filled with information from the extremes of the bell curve of human experience, because in the media business thats what gets eyeballs, and eyeballs bring dollars. Thats the bottom line. Yet the vast majority of life resides in the humdrum middle. The vast majority of life is unextraordinary, indeed quite average.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The inundation of the exceptional makes people feel worse about themselves, makes them feel that they need to be more extreme, more radical, and more self-assured to get noticed or even matter.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Technology has solved old economic problems by giving us new psychological problems.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The Internet has not just open-sourced information; it has also open-sourced insecurity, self-doubt, and shame.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Being average has become the new standard of failure.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Once you accept the premise that a life is worthwhile only if it is truly notable and great, then you basically accept the fact that most of the human population (including yourself) sucks and is worthless.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The rare people who do become truly exceptional at something do so not because they believe theyre exceptional. On the contrary, they become amazing because theyre obsessed with improvement.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People who become great at something become great because they understand that theyre not already great—they are mediocre, they are average—and that they could be so much better.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “If suffering is inevitable, if our problems in life are unavoidable, then the question we should be asking is not How do I stop suffering? but Why am I suffering—for what purpose?”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “We get to control what our problems mean based on how we choose to think about them, the standard by which we choose to measure them.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The question is not whether we evaluate ourselves against others; rather, the question is by what standard do we measure ourselves?”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “If you want to change how you see your problems, you have to change what you value and/or how you measure failure/success.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Pleasure is great, but its a horrible value to prioritize your life around.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “               Pleasure is a false god.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Research shows that people who focus their energy on superficial pleasures end up more anxious, more emotionally unstable, and more depressed.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Pleasure is the most superficial form of life satisfaction and therefore the easiest to obtain and the easiest to lose.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Once one is able to provide for basic physical needs (food, shelter, and so on), the correlation between happiness and worldly success quickly approaches zero.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “When people measure themselves not by their behavior, but by the status symbols theyre able to collect, then not only are they shallow, but theyre probably assholes as well.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Its far more helpful to assume that youre ignorant and dont know a whole lot. This keeps you unattached to superstitious or poorly informed beliefs and promotes a constant state of learning and growth.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Denying negative emotions leads to experiencing deeper and more prolonged negative emotions and to emotional dysfunction.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Things go wrong, people upset us, accidents happen. These things make us feel like shit. And thats fine. Negative emotions are a necessary component of emotional health. To deny that negativity is to perpetuate problems rather than solve them.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “One day, in retrospect, the years of struggle will strike you as the most beautiful.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Some of the greatest moments of ones life are not pleasant, not successful, not known, and not positive.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People who are terrified of what others think about them are actually terrified of all the shitty things they think about themselves being reflected back at them.)”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Honesty, innovation, vulnerability, standing up for oneself, standing up for others, self-respect, curiosity, charity, humility, creativity.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “When you give better fucks, you get better problems. And when you get better problems, you get a better life.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Often the only difference between a problem being painful or being powerful is a sense that we chose it, and that we are responsible for it.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “There is a simple realization from which all personal improvement and growth emerges. This is the realization that we, individually, are responsible for everything in our lives, no matter the external circumstances.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People who date each other tend to have similar values. And if I dated someone with shitty values for that long, what did that say about me and my values?”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “We all love to take responsibility for success and happiness. Hell, we often fight over who gets to be responsible for success and happiness. But taking responsibility for our problems is far more important, because thats where the real learning comes from. Thats where the real-life improvement comes from. To simply blame others is only to hurt yourself.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Do, or do not; there is no how.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People get addicted to feeling offended all the time because it gives them a high; being self-righteous and morally superior feels good.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “You are already choosing, in every moment of every day, what to give a fuck about, so change is as simple as choosing to give a fuck about something else.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “I used to think the human brain was the most wonderful organ in my body. Then I realized who was telling me this.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Im always wrong about everything, over and over and over again, and thats why my life improves.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Certainty is the enemy of growth. Nothing is for certain until it has already happened—and even then, its still debatable.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “All beliefs are wrong—some are just less wrong than others.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Many of the relationships in your life were built around the values youve been keeping, so the moment you change those values—the moment you decide that studying is more important than partying, that getting married and having a family is more important than rampant sex, that working a job you believe in is more important than money—your turnaround will reverberate out through your relationships, and many of them will blow up in your face.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “We all do this. You do. I do. No matter how honest and well-intentioned we are, were in a perpetual state of misleading ourselves and others for no other reason than that our brain is designed to be efficient, not accurate.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Instead of striving for certainty, we should be in constant search of doubt: doubt about our own beliefs, doubt about our own feelings, doubt about what the future may hold for us unless we get out there and create it for ourselves.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “In an effort to achieve coherence, our mind will sometimes, in cases like that, invent false memories. By linking our present experiences with that imagined past, our mind allows us to maintain whatever meaning we already established.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Our brain is always trying to make sense of our current situation based on what we already believe and have already experienced.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “We shouldnt seek to find the ultimate right answer for ourselves, but rather, we should seek to chip away at the ways that were wrong today so that we can be a little less wrong tomorrow.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Every new piece of information is measured against the values and conclusions we already have. As a result, our brain is always biased toward what we feel to be true in that moment.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Merediths story is not unique. In fact, in the 1980s and early 1990s, hundreds of innocent people were wrongly accused of sexual violence under similar circumstances. Many of them went to prison for it.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Our minds biggest priority when processing experiences is to interpret them in such a way that they will cohere with all of our previous experiences, feelings, and beliefs.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “For people who were dissatisfied with their lives, these suggestive explanations, combined with the sensationalizing media—there were veritable epidemics of sexual abuse and satanic violence going on, and you could be a victim too—gave peoples unconscious minds the incentive to fudge their memories a bit and explain their current suffering in a way that allowed them to be victims and avoid responsibility.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Theres a lot of conventional wisdom out there telling you to trust yourself, to go with your gut, and all sorts of other pleasant-sounding clichés. But perhaps the answer is to trust yourself less. After all, if our hearts and minds are so unreliable, maybe we should be questioning our own intentions and motivations more.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “If were all wrong, all the time, then isnt self-skepticism and the rigorous challenging of our own beliefs and assumptions the only logical route to progress?”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The more you try to be certain about something, the more uncertain and insecure you will feel.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The man who believes he knows everything learns nothing.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The more we admit we do not know, the more opportunities we gain to learn.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Openness to being wrong must exist for any real change or growth to take place.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Murphys law: Whatever can go wrong will go wrong.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “To stare our own ignorance in the face and concede, because our own ignorance is greater than us all.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People are often so afraid of success—for the exact same reason theyre afraid of failure: it threatens who they believe themselves to be.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Never know who you are. Because thats what keeps you striving and discovering.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The more something threatens your identity, the more you will avoid it.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Buddhism argues that your idea of who you are is an arbitrary mental construction and that you should let go of the idea that you exist at all; that the arbitrary metrics by which you define yourself actually trap you, and thus youre better off letting go of everything.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “As a general rule, were all the worlds worst observers of ourselves. When were angry, or jealous, or upset, were oftentimes the last ones to figure it out. And the only way to figure it out is to put cracks in our armor of certainty by consistently questioning how wrong we might be about ourselves.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “It is the mark of an educated mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Improvement at anything is based on thousands of tiny failures, and the magnitude of your success is based on how many times youve failed at something.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Remain humble and admit ignorance.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “If someone is better than you at something, then its likely because she has failed at it more than you have.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “We can be truly successful only at something were willing to fail at.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “If were unwilling to fail, then were unwilling to succeed.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Pain is part of the process.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Life is about not knowing and then doing something anyway.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Learn to sustain the pain youve chosen.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “If youre stuck on a problem, dont sit there and think about it; just start working on it. Even if you dont know what youre doing, the simple act of working on it will eventually cause the right ideas to show up in your head.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “If you lack the motivation to make an important change in your life, do something—anything, really—and then harness the reaction to that action as a way to begin motivating yourself.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Dont just sit there. Do something. The answers will follow.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “We are defined by what we choose to reject.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Travel is a fantastic self-development tool, because it extricates you from the values of your culture and shows you that another society can live with entirely different values and still function and not hate themselves.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Unhealthy love is based on two people trying to escape their problems through their emotions for each other—in other words, theyre using each other as an escape. Healthy love is based on two people acknowledging and addressing their own problems with each others support.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Romantic love is kind of like cocaine. Like, frighteningly similar to cocaine. Like, stimulates the exact same parts of your brain as cocaine. Like, gets you high and makes you feel good for a while but also creates as many problems as it solves, as does cocaine.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “People cant solve your problems for you.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Entitled people who blame others for their own emotions and actions do so because they believe that if they constantly paint themselves as victims, eventually someone will come along and save them, and they will receive the love theyve always wanted.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Without conflict, there can be no trust. Conflict exists to show us who is there for us unconditionally and who is just there for the benefits.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Acts of love are valid only if theyre performed without conditions or expectations.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The last person I should ever have to censor myself with is the woman I love.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Honesty in my relationship is more important to me than feeling good all the time.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “No one trusts a yes-man.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “For victims, the hardest thing to do in the world is to hold themselves accountable for their problems. Theyve spent their whole life believing that others are responsible for their fate.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “When youre pursuing a wide breadth of experience, there are diminishing returns to each new adventure, each new person or thing.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Pursuing a breadth of experience denies us the opportunity to experience the rewards of depth of experience.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Ive chosen to reject all but the very best people and experiences and values in my life.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “There is a freedom and liberation in commitment.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Death is the light by which the shadow of all of lifes meaning is measured.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Whether it be through mastering an art form, conquering a new land, gaining great riches, or simply having a large and loving family that will live on for generations, all the meaning in our life is shaped by this innate desire to never truly die.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Immortality projects, projects that allow our conceptual self to live on way past the point of our physical death.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “What is your legacy?”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Without death, everything would feel inconsequential, all experience arbitrary, all metrics and values suddenly zero.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “This acceptance of my death, this understanding of my own fragility, has made everything easier—untangling my addictions, identifying and confronting my own entitlement, accepting responsibility for my own problems—suffering through my fears and uncertainties, accepting my failures and embracing rejections—it has all been made lighter by the thought of my own death.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “The only way to be comfortable with death is to understand and see yourself as something bigger than yourself; to choose values that stretch beyond serving yourself, that are simple and immediate and controllable and tolerant of the chaotic world around you.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson

highlight.Text: “Our culture today confuses great attention and great success, assuming them to be the same thing.”

allHighlights.title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a Fck
allHighlights.author: Mark Manson
